lead_paragraph: Distinctive vehicles, once a symbol of national hopes, carry besieged rebels and civilians toward an uncertain fate as they yield land to government forces.

byline.contributor: Maher Samaan contributed reporting from Paris, and an employee of The New York Times from Damascus.
byline.original: By ANNE BARNARD and HWAIDA SAAD

headline.print_headline: Syrians’ Stark Choice: ‘Doom’ or the Green Bus
headline.main: Stark Choice for Syrians in Rebel Areas: ‘Doom’ or the Green Bus

snippet: Distinctive vehicles, once a symbol of national hopes, carry besieged rebels and civilians toward an uncertain fate as they yield land to government forces....
abstract: Syrians dread lime green public buses that have been repurposed for evacuating residents from cities besieged by government forces; vehicles, once a symbol of national hopes, now offer their passengers grim choice between continued bombardment in rebel-held area or possible detention in government territory.
